availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Peter Evans Sr. (Clark County, Kentucky, physician.)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married Letitia Quishenberry Evans in Clark County, Kentucky, on October 20, 1835. Father of James E. Evans, Peter Evans Jr., Mary C. Evans and George W. Evans. Physician in Clark County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Clark County in 1850. Physician in Clark County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Clark County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 12B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 287.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 802.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 331A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clark County Marriages, Film 001943687, p. 39.
"Dr. Peter Evans (1808-1883)," Find A Grave, Memorial 75369938, accessed April 14, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/75369938.
